channel.title: Can source and client run on website together
channel.description:
I tried posting this idea before and i feel like everyone thought i was stupid but i wanna try one more time Okay so this is the regular html code for website to load the client jar file [code] YOUR CLIENT

Anything Here! Anything Here!
Anything Here! [/code] So is there a way i could make the source into a jar file and make the website load it to so people can play my rsps in localhost ip like 127.0.0.1 since i cant host my server because my router wont allow it.

item.source: Can source and client run on website together

item.title: Can source and client run on website together
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

Lmao, this has absolutely nothing to do with SQL. It is possible to JAR a source, yes. As for having people host it from their computer and still all be playing together, I’m not sure if that’s possible… Go to http://www.moparisthebest.com/ and you’ll see a running example, but that allows you to connect locally… I’m sure this is possible, just takes a level of expertise that’s above my concept of knowledge.

Read full topic
item.source: Can source and client run on website together

item.title: Can source and client run on website together
item.dc:creator: @hadlich4 hadlich4
item.description:
@hadlich4 wrote:

[quote=“codyorr4, post:2, topic:546159”]maybe with SQL, but not for sure.

i don’t see it working bc the client uses the ip to connect to the server.

maybe you could try jarring the server lol.

or giving it a certain directory to look for the source so instead people can use your website for clients.

for example set it too, C:/blah/blah/blah/ClientWebsite/source

then once people load that page, with their related client (make pages for individual clients. like 317, 474, 508, 525 all the way to 718 or 803) itll look for that source in the directory all you gotta do now is compile and run that client on your website,

i think it wouldn’t be too useful but neat,

what would make it somewhat useful is allow those people to change the clients ip.

so they can connect to a source that is online.

add the same for compiling, or somthing that compiles automatically as soon as its found the source in the directory

and allow other players to use that website to play webclients.

kinda like rswebs i suppose lol.[/quote]

I may try to do this in the future but i dont know i dont think i have enough web designing knowledge to do this but it help me so greatly

Read full topic

item.title: Can source and client run on website together
item.dc:creator: @codyorr4 codyorr4
item.description:
@codyorr4 wrote:

maybe with SQL, but not for sure.

i don’t see it working bc the client uses the ip to connect to the server.

maybe you could try jarring the server lol.

or giving it a certain directory to look for the source so instead people can use your website for clients.

for example set it too, C:/blah/blah/blah/ClientWebsite/source

then once people load that page, with their related client (make pages for individual clients. like 317, 474, 508, 525 all the way to 718 or 803) itll look for that source in the directory all you gotta do now is compile and run that client on your website,

i think it wouldn’t be too useful but neat,

what would make it somewhat useful is allow those people to change the clients ip.

so they can connect to a source that is online.

add the same for compiling, or somthing that compiles automatically as soon as its found the source in the directory

and allow other players to use that website to play webclients.

kinda like rswebs i suppose lol.

Read full topic
item.source: Can source and client run on website together

item.title: Can source and client run on website together
item.dc:creator: @hadlich4 hadlich4
item.description:
@hadlich4 wrote:

I tried posting this idea before and i feel like everyone thought i was stupid but i wanna try one more time

Okay so this is the regular html code for website to load the client jar file

<HTML>
<HEAD>
<TITLE>YOUR CLIENT</TITLE>
<body bgcolor="black">
<META HTTP-EQUIV="PRAGMA" CONTENT="NO-CACHE">
</HEAD>

<BODY>
<center>
<applet name="Anything Here" width="765" height="503" archive="client.jar" code="client.class">
<param name="java_arguments" value="-Xmx1024m">
</applet>
<p>
<font color="white"><b>Anything Here!</b> <I>

Anything Here!
</br>
Anything Here!
</I></font>

</BODY>
</HTML>

So is there a way i could make the source into a jar file and make the website load it to so people can play my rsps in localhost ip like 127.0.0.1 since i cant host my server because my router wont allow it.

Read full topic
item.source: Can source and client run on website together
